title: For Sale:  Colt 1911 Black Army made 1918
postcontent:
Colt Model of 1911 U.S. Army  s/n 251,XXX dates to early 1918.  All parts are correct for a pre March 1918 weapon.  Early slide markings, US property mark on the left side of the frame, JMG acceptance mark above the magazine catch, Colt rampant horse at the back of the slide and shorter radius of the recoil spring housing at the front of the slide.

This pistol is in very good condition.  A large amount of original blue remains, approximately 80%.  The wear shows this pistol has spent some time in a holster.  The edges are bright and the finish is spotty on the forward end of the slide and frame.  There is a slight bit of rust pitting in the right side cocking serrations, mostly likely due to corrosion of a brass holster snap.  The finish on the front strap of the grip has mostly been worn away.  A small dent is also present at the front right corner of the slide, this is hardly noticeable and does not effect the function or accuracy of this pistol.

The magazine included is not original.

$2200

Additional pictures can be seen at:
http://s1322.photobucket.com/albums/u563/mope34/Colt/1918%20Black%20Army/

title: For Sale:  Sporterized Springfield Model 1903A3 300 Savage
postcontent:
I have a beautiful Springfield Model 1903 A3 converted to a 300 Savage the maker mark on the barrel is from AD Fokey of San Antonio Texas it has been tapped for a scope and will come with a set of weaver scope rings. I am Asking 550$ OBO there is some room wiggle room in the price. There are some blemishes on the stock and barrel but works flawlessly the receiver from Springfield has a serial number is 488XXX circa 1911  This is a great hunting rifle and A nice piece of Texas history.



Mr. Forkey was a barrel maker for Mr. Robert Kleingunther of Sequin Texas in the 40's and 50's. As the story goes, Mr. Forkey and Mr. Kleingunther had a falling out and Mr. Forkey started making his own sporterized 03-A3's. Mr. Forkey completed about 50 rifles and then suddenly died of a heart attack. The Stock comes from another San Antonio gentleman named Alex Harper who was known for his intricate stock engraving and worked at Nagel's gun in the 1930's this has been confirmed by a local gun dealer

title: For Sale:  AR500 Plate & Target Stand for all calibers!
postcontent:
This is a very heavy duty construction. I used this several times out shooting 600+ yards with a .308. The entire setup is designed to take the hits(even the stand, chains and bolts). If you paint the plate it helps to see your hits through the spotting scope at distance, I haven't painted it since my last trip as you can see. I spend over $80 on the stand building it from parts purchased locally at home depot, the AR500 Plate was purchased online and the mounting chains totaled more than $30.

Build one yourself and spend almost $150 or buy mine, paint the plate and take it to the mountains. These things are great for shooting up close with handguns and ARs also!

Note: The AR plate hangs upside down because of the positioning of the mounting holes. It was meant to be on a stand, not hung. When I take it out, I load the plate and chains in my ruck because it's easier to hike with the bare stand over my shoulders otherwise I would have welded it all in place...

postcontent:
HUNTERS! HUNTERS! HUNTERS!

The Improved Load Bearing System (ILBE) backpack was created for use by the United States Marine Corps. The system was created by Arc‚Äôteryx‚Äôs Law Enforcement and Armed Forces (LEAF) program.

Its standalone capacity is 1,500 inches of cubic space with a load capacity of 25 to 40 pounds. It had two separate storage compartments as well as an inner pocket. The inner pocket designed to house the ILBE Hydration System can hold a bladder containing up to 100 ounces of water.

Like the ILBE Main Pack, the Assault Pack is made from Cordura 725 fabric and is also imprinted with the same MARPAT (MARine PATtern) as the other components of the ILBE. The standard measurements for an Assault Pack are approximately 6‚Ä≥ deep, 12‚Ä≥ wide, and 18‚Ä≥ tall. They come equipped with two quick release padded shoulder straps that are connected by a chest strap as well as a 2‚Ä≥ wide waist belt with a quick release buckle. The Assault Pack also has a removable plastic panel that provides extra stiffness when needed as well as a back panel which is padded for extra comfort.

Hunters and outdoors persons, the pack has a Pouch Attachment Ladder System (PALS) grid which allows various smaller items to be attached such as knife sheaths, flashlights, holsters, arrows, and ammunition pouches.

 December 8th 9A.M-5P.M
 December 29th 9A.M-5P.M

Certified CCH Instructor
 NRA Instructor

By completing this class you will then be eligible to apply for your Kansas Carry Conceal License through the Attorney General's office.

The class covers CCH law, Use of Force, Basic Marksmanship, Care and Maintenance, Weapon Selection, Holster Selection, Methods of Carry, Self Defense, and Interaction with Law Enforcement. 

There is a written exam along with a shooting test. You don't need to worry about either test as I give you everything you will need to pass them both during the 8 hour course. 

I have no minimums on my classes and will NOT cancel them because I don't have enough people for the class. One person is all it takes.

You can bring your own pistol for the shooting portion along with 50 rounds of ammunition. I recommend using a .22 however any caliber is accepted. If you don't have a pistol yet or would just like to borrow mine I have a .22 Ruger.

 Classes will be located just east of Derby at

title: For Sale:  Taser X26C Package
location: Snow Hill, NC, Greenville, North Carolina
postcontent:
The TASER X26C Electronic Control Device (ECD), is based on our law enforcement-grade TASER X26, and gives you the same unprecedented take-down power trusted by thousands of police officers every day.

In a more compact form factor than our Advanced TASER¬Æ M26C‚Ñ¢ ECD, the X26C is designed to be comfortable to carry and easy to use. When you flip the safety into the armed position, the device is ready to deliver an incapacitating pulse that is designed to override the sensory and motor functions of the nervous system. This powerful Neuro Muscular Incapacitation (NMI) technology can stop even the most aggressive individuals, including those under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol.

TASER ECDs use replaceable cartridges containing inert, compressed nitrogen to fire two small probes that are attached to 15 foot (4.5 meter) insulated conductive wires. Energy is sent over the wires into the probes, which can penetrate up to two cumulative inches of clothing. The charge is transmitted between the two probes, jamming sensory and motor functions, and inhibiting muscular control. This NMI effect continues in 10 second cycles each time you press the trigger. The X26C ECDs can also be used in direct contact stun mode.

Effective

TASER ECDs are the only devices that allow you to take control of your personal safety by consistently incapacitating aggressive, dangerous people.

Safe

Safer and more effective than other options, such as sprays or direct contact stuns, which require potentially dangerous chemicals or close range to an attacker and often prove to be ineffective on individuals under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol.

Keeps You Safe at a Distance

Unlike other options which require you to be close to the target, TASER ECDs are effective at a range of up to 15 feet, which keeps you out of harm's way.

Easy To Use

The TASER X26C has been designed for easy use during high stress deployment situations. Combining a LASER sight and LED light with a quick flip safety, the X26C allows you to respond quickly and effectively to a threat.

Police Proven

The TASER X26C is based on the same design used by law enforcement worldwide. It's designed to be compact and easy to carry and to give a 10 second cycle of incapacitation that gives you time to get in control of a threatening situation and get to safety

When an X26C, M26C, or C2 ECD is used in self-defense, the ECDs may be deployed and left behind providing the Purchaser a window of opportunity to get to safety and call law enforcement.
